snippet: The proposed labor contract covering 30,000 union members in New York City is so advantageous to workers that it seems born from a different era.
abstract: Proposed labor contract covering 30,000 members of the New York Hotel and Motel Trades Council, AFL-CIO, is so beneficial to workers that it seems born from a different era; wages will rise by more than 29 percent over the next seven years under the contract, in addition to full benefits for employees; officials of other unions dismiss the proposed contract as a special case, supportable because of record high hotel occupancy rates and profits as tourists flock to New York.
lead_paragraph: The proposed labor contract covering 30,000 union members in New York City is so advantageous to workers that it seems born from a different era.

headline.seo: Contract for New York’s Hotel Union Is Seen by Some as Special Case
headline.main: Deal Beneficial to Hotel Union Is Seen by Some as Special Case
headline.print_headline: Deal Beneficial To Hotel Union Is Seen by Some As Special Case

keywords.value: American Federation of Labor-Congress of Industrial Organizations
keywords.name: organizations
